item.title: Skigirl add a quote by Tom Bissell
item.description: "The world, finally, is no longer large, and to ignore it likely requires more effort than to simply take notice." -- Tom Bissell

item.title: Skigirl add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The world as we have created it is a process of our thinking. It cannot be changed without changing our thinking." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Skigirl add a quote by John Muir
item.description: "When one tugs at a single thing in nature, he finds it attached to the rest of the world." -- John Muir

item.title: Skigirl add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Skigirl add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Skigirl add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Skigirl add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Skigirl add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Skigirl add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Skigirl add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Skigirl add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Skigirl add a quote by Marianne Williamson
item.description: "Our deepest fear is not that we are inadequate. Our deepest fear is that we are powerful beyond measure. It is our light, not our darkness that most frightens us. We ask ourselves, 'Who am I to be brilliant, gorgeous, talented, fabulous?' Actually, who are you not to be? You are a child of God. Your playing small does not serve the world. There is nothing enlightened about shrinking so that other people won't feel insecure around you. We are all meant to shine, as children do. We were born to make manifest the glory of God that is within us. It's not just in some of us; it's in everyone. And as we let our own light shine, we unconsciously give other people permission to do the same. As we are liberated from our own fear, our presence automatically liberates others." -- Marianne Williamson

item.title: Skigirl add a quote by Nelson Mandela
item.description: "There is nothing like returning to a place that remains unchanged to find the ways in which you yourself have altered." -- Nelson Mandela

item.title: Skigirl add a quote by Desmond Tutu
item.description: "There is nothing more difficult than waking someone who is only pretending to be asleep." -- Desmond Tutu

item.title: Skigirl add a quote by Desmond Tutu
item.description: "We learn from history that we don't learn from history!" -- Desmond Tutu

item.title: Skigirl add a quote by Isak Dinesen
item.description: "You know you are truly alive when youâ€™re living among lions." -- Isak Dinesen

item.title: Skigirl add a quote by Bill Bryson
item.description: "I can't think of anything that excites a greater sense of childlike wonder than to be in a country where you are ignorant of almost everything." -- Bill Bryson

item.title: Skigirl add a quote by Bill Bryson
item.description: "We used to build civilizations. Now we build shopping malls." -- Bill Bryson

item.title: Skigirl add a quote by Bill Bryson
item.description: "Black bears rarely attack. But here's the thing. Sometimes they do. All bears are agile, cunning and immensely strong, and they are always hungry. If they want to kill you and eat you, they can, and pretty much whenever they want. That doesn't happen often, but - and here is the absolutely salient point - once would be enough." -- Bill Bryson

item.title: Skigirl add a quote by Bill Bryson
item.description: "I mused for a few moments on the question of which was worse, to lead a life so boring that you are easily enchanted, or a life so full of stimulus that you are easily bored." -- Bill Bryson

item.title: Skigirl add a quote by Bill Bryson
item.description: "Is there anything, apart from a really good chocolate cream pie and receiving a large unexpected cheque in the post, to beat finding yourself at large in a foreign city on a fair spring evening, loafing along unfamiliar streets in the long shadows of a lazy sunset, pausing to gaze in shop windows or at some church or lovely square or tranquil stretch of quayside, hesitating at street corners to decide whether that cheerful and homy restaurant you will remember fondly for years is likely to lie down this street or that one? I just love it. I could spend my life arriving each evening in a new city." -- Bill Bryson

item.title: Skigirl add a quote by Bill Bryson
item.description: "Tune your television to any channel it doesn't receive and about 1 percent of the dancing static you see is accounted for by this ancient remnant of the Big Bang. The next time you complain that there is nothing on, remember that you can always watch the birth of the universe." -- Bill Bryson

item.title: Skigirl add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "Disbelief in magic can force a poor soul into believing in government and business." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Skigirl add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "Just because you're naked doesn't mean you're sexy. Just because you're cynical doesn't mean you're cool." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Skigirl add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "There are only two mantras, yum and yuck, mine is yum." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Skigirl add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "A sense of humor...is superior to any religion so far devised." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Skigirl add a quote by Julia Child
item.description: "The only time to eat diet food is while you're waiting for the steak to cook." -- Julia Child

item.title: Skigirl add a quote by Julia Child
item.description: "The only real stumbling block is fear of failure. In cooking you've got to have a what-the-hell attitude." -- Julia Child

item.title: Skigirl add a quote by Julia Child
item.description: "It's so beautifully arranged on the plate - you know someone's fingers have been all over it." -- Julia Child

item.title: Skigirl add a quote by Julia Child
item.description: "If you're afraid of butter, use cream." -- Julia Child
